remarks: Two subwords of words are equal iff they have the same length and the same symbols at each position.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 7-Aug-2018.)
statement:
swrdeq $p |- ( ( ( W e. Word V /\ U e. Word V ) /\ ( M e. NN0 /\ N e. NN0 ) /\ ( M <_ ( # ` W ) /\ N <_ ( # ` U ) ) ) -> ( ( W substr <. 0 , M >. ) = ( U substr <. 0 , N >. ) <-> ( M = N /\ A. i e. ( 0 ..^ M ) ( W ` i ) = ( U ` i ) ) ) ) $.
$d M i $.
$d N i $.
$d U i $.
$d V i $.
$d W i $.
